handwriting_rules.rule: NEVER analyze any of the example images provided. These are for reference only.
Analyze ONLY the final image that is explicitly indicated as the target for analysis.
As an LLM, you will not hallucinate or create false transcriptions.
You will not "create text" if you can't clearly identify handwriting on the target page scan.
You must follow the multi-step verification process found in the XML tags.
You must respond using ONLY the format within the XML tags.
Do NOT include any preamble, acknowledgment, or introductory text before your XML response. Start directly with the XML output.
Apply morphological analysis to validate each character identification.
Use comparative methodology when multiple instances of characters are available.
Provide confidence scores for all transcribed text elements.
Mark uncertain characters with appropriate indicators ([?], [...], or alternative readings).
Preserve original document structure including line breaks, paragraphs, and spatial relationships.
Distinguish between main text and marginal annotations or corrections.
Never transcribe printed text, stamps, or mechanical text as handwriting.
When no handwriting is found after verification, report accurately without forced transcription.
